snippet: Foreign diplomats, human rights organizations and Lebanese citizens denounced the move as detrimental to the country’s democracy.
abstract: Members of Lebanon's Parliament vote by large margin to extend their own terms in office by more than two and a half years, contending that country's tenuous security situation makes it too difficult to hold elections; foreign diplomats, human rights organizations and many Lebanese citizens denounced move as undermining democratic practices in region dominated by strongmen and monarchs.

byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and BEN HUBBARD
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Ben Hubbard from Baghdad.

lead_paragraph: Foreign diplomats, human rights organizations and Lebanese citizens denounced the move as detrimental to the country’s democracy.

headline.main: Citing Volatility, Lawmakers in Lebanon Vote to Extend Their Term
headline.print_headline: Citing Volatility, Lawmakers in Lebanon Vote to Extend Their Term
